repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: This collection was donated to the Archives by Fred Gowing's daughter Jean Gowing in October 1980 via the Alumni House.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains Fred Gowing's Tufts memorabilia, acceptance letter and tuition bills, 1879-1881; and correspondence, mostly related to Gowing's work as a high school principal and superintendent, 1881-1917.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Mr. Gowing graduated from Tufts in 1881 and received an honorary doctorate in 1897. He served as principal in several high schools and schools throughout the Northeastern United States. He was principal (president) of Rhode Island College from 1898-1901. He died March 20 1921.

processinfo.head: Processing status
processinfo.p: This collection is minimally processed and may not be available for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA for further details.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproduction and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Any intellectual property rights that the donor possesses have not been transferred to Tufts University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts memorabilia, acceptance letter and tuition bills, 1879-1881; and correspondence, mostly related to Gowing's work as a high school principal and superintendent, 1881-1917.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Correspondence is arranged in reverse chronological order. Other materials are not arranged.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts memorabilia, acceptance letter and tuition bills, 1879-1881; and correspondence, mostly related to Gowing's work as a high school principal and superintendent, 1881-1917.
